availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Harrison Caywood (Montgomery County, Kentucky, merchant, farmer, and auctioneer)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, merchant, farmer, and auctioneer. Kentucky native. Married to Angeline Wilson Caywood. Father of James Tilford Caywood and Alice D. Wilson. Merchant in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1850. Owned at least two enslaved persons, including Nancy, in Montgomery County in 1859. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1860. Auctioneer in Montgomery County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860. Owned at least two enslaved persons, including Caroline, in Montgomery County in 1861. Auctioneer in Montgomery County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
